frame.name: Cause_to_amalgamate
frame.definition:
<def-root>These words refer to an <fen>Agent</fen> joining <fen>Parts</fen> to form a <fen>Whole</fen>. (The <fen>Parts</fen> may also be encoded as <fen>Part_1</fen> and <fen>Part_2</fen>.) There is a symmetrical relationship between the components that undergo the process, and afterwards the <fen>Parts</fen> are consumed and are no longer distinct entities that are easily discernable or separable in the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Chuck</fex> <t>merged</t> <fex name="Parts">the corpora</fex>.</ex><ex> <fex name="Agent">Chuck</fex> <t>merged</t> <fex name="Parts">the corpora</fex> <fex name="Whole">into a database</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Chuck</fex> <t>merged</t> <fex name="Part_1">the BNC</fex> <fex name="Part_2">with the AP Corpus</fex> <fex name="Whole">into a database</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Parts">The two forces</fex> <t>merged</t> <fex name="Whole">into a single, undifferentiated mass of murderous mayhem</fex>.(Sense 2)</ex> <ex>Melt the butter, then <t>blend</t> <fex name="Part_1">it</fex> <fex name="Part_2">with the room temperature milk</fex>. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>In causative uses of these verbs there is an <fen>Agent</fen> responsible for amalgamating the <fen>Parts</fen>. The <fen>Agent</fen> is generally the External Argument (or the object of a PP-by in passives).<ex><fex name="Agent">The chef</fex> <t>combined</t> the ingredients.</ex><ex>The ingredients were <t>combined</t> <fex name="Agent">by the chef</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies <fen>Whole</fen> as the entity resulting from combination of <fen>Parts</fen>. When overtly expressed, it is usually a PP Complement (often headed by into).<ex>Chuck <t>merged</t> the corpora <fex name="Whole">into a database</fex>.</ex> <ex>The directors <t>merged</t> the two companies <fex name="Whole">into a conglomorate</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parts
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Parts</fen> entities being combined, and is often expressed in a single plural NP, usually the direct object of a verb. <ex>Chuck <t>merged</t> <fex name="Parts">the corpora</fex> into a database.</ex><ex>The directors <t>merged</t> <fex name="Parts">the two companies</fex> into a conglomerate.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the first of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. It is most often the NP-Object of a verb.
<ex>The workmen <t>joined</t> <fex name="Part_1">the annex</fex> to the main building.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. It is usually a PP Complement.
<ex>The workkmen <t>joined</t> the annex <fex name="Part_2">to the main building</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the amalgamating occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the thoroughness of the mixing job, i.e. to what degree the resulting <fen>Whole</fen> is undifferentiated.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the amalgamating occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for indicating the <fen>Result</fen> of amalgamating. <ex>Chuck <t>merged</t> the corpora <fex name="Result">together</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Parts</fen> during the amalgamation. Often it refers to the proportion of the <fen>Parts</fen> to one another.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> seeks to bring about by the Amalgamation.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the amalgamation occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: amalgamate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: combine or unite to form one organization or structure.

lexUnit.name: combine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: unite; merge; unite to form a compound

lexUnit.name: fuse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause two or more entities to blend together

lexUnit.name: join.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to be fused with and connected to.

lexUnit.name: merge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause one or more entities to become one

lexUnit.name: unify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become united or uniform.

lexUnit.name: unite.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause two or more entities to blend together to form a whole

lexUnit.name: meld.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause one item to blend with at least one additional item

lexUnit.name: blend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to mix something with something else

lexUnit.name: commingle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause on item to blend together with another item

lexUnit.name: intermix.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause two or more items to become blended together

lexUnit.name: mix.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: combine to form a whole

lexUnit.name: lump.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put in an indiscriminate mass or group.

lexUnit.name: bring together.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: join two or more items .

lexUnit.name: coalesce.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring together

lexUnit.name: compound.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: mix or combine (ingredients or constituents).

lexUnit.name: conflate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: combine into one.

lexUnit.name: consolidate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: combine into a single unit.

lexUnit.name: flux.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: treat (a metal object) with a flux to promote melting.

lexUnit.name: admix.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: mix with something else.

lexUnit.name: jumble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: mix up in a confused way.

lexUnit.name: pair.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: join two items to form a pair.

lexUnit.name: throw together.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause two or more things to be merged

lexUnit.name: fold.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to combine by gently adding one part to another, usually used in baking

lexUnit.name: merger.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: The act of combining two or more entities into one. "Chuck's merger of the corpora won him an award."

lexUnit.name: combination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: The act of combining, or the result of agentive combining.
